content:
Hi! When cargo-building some project with the recent rustc v1.45.0 new warning messages pop up:

The bin target 'foo-bar' in package ... has the same output filename as the lib target 'foo_bar' in package ...
Colliding filename is: C:\...\foo_bar.pdb

Both target names differ in the separator being either an underscore or hyphen character. The linker PDB output file always seems to use an underscore, though.

Are the linker arguments generated in rustc or cargo? Any pointers where to look in source code?
I would like to find out where the PDB output filename is set.

Ok, think I found the relevant lines in src/librustc_codegen_ssa/back/linker.rs of the Rust code.
Unfortunately looks like the PDB output filename is auto-generated by MSVC link.exe.
